title.narrative: U-LEAD SALAR Support to the Roll-out Phase 2018-2020
U-LEAD SKR stöd till roll-out fasen 2018-2020

description.narrative: For the Roll-out phase of U-LEAD, Sida will procure implementing partners to support the establishment of up to 575 administrative service centres. This contribution is about SALAR's role to select feasible local authorities and together with them work out a programme for how the establishment of the administrative service centre should be carried out in each local authority. This will be executed in four batches, with around 150 local authorities in each batch. SALAR will also work with policy support, methods support, peer review and exchange between administrative service centers and be responsible for coordination and implementation of communication and visibility in Sida's U-LEAD programme.

För Roll-out fasen av U-LEAD kommer Sida att handla upp implementerande partners för att stödja etablerandet av upp till 575 administrativa service centran i Ukraina. Denna insats avser att SKL ska arbeta med att välja ut lämpliga kommuner och tillsammans med dessa arbeta fram ett underlag för hur etableringen av det administrativa service centrat ska gå till i respektive kommun. Detta kommer att ske i fyra omgångar, med cirka 150 kommuner i varje omgång. Dessutom kommer SKL i denna insats arbeta med policyrådgivning, metodstöd, utbyte mellan etablerade administrativa service center och med att samordna och övergripande ansvara för kommunikation och synlighet inom Sidas U-LEAD program.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: From the start of the Roll-Out Phase SALARS’s team has processed (received and assessed) 1088 applications, visited 568 Hromadas and cities. This work has resulted in preparation of 464 ToRs that target 536 AHs and small cities. If all ToRs are implemented and followed through, the total number of residents that will receive improved service delivery closer to their homes makes approximately 9.5 million. Methodological manuals are developed to support the Programme participants and the implementing partners. They are meant to ensure that a coherent approach and quality standards are applied for all elements of the support. The Support Package currently comprises eight manuals (six of them are published and available online), several videos, podcasts and information brochures. The manuals and support materials build on the experiences of the Inception Phase and the Roll-Out Phase. The Manual formats vary, depending on their purpose and target groups. SALAR’s unit for methodological support works closely with the Communication Team and many events on launches of updated manuals were carried out. Below follows a status update for some of the manuals. 1) Institutional Establishment of an ASC in an amalgamated Hromada (also called“How to establish an ASC from scratch”) This manual is a textbook and currently comprises 200 pages, plus annexes with several templates (of forms to be used when providing service and agreements to enter when establishing centres). In order to communicate about the well-functioning ASC to general public in August 2019 the podcast “What is a well-functioning ASC” was produced and disseminated via social medias and the web page of the Programme. 2) Manual for physical establishment of an ASC comprises guidelines for establishment of an ASC in a local and rural context. 3) Gender Guidelines for working with and within an ASC. The updated Gender Manual was presented on the 9 December 2019 at the Working group on gender equality and decentralisation coordinated by the UN Women and chaired by the Ministry of development of hromadas and territories. 4) Training manual for ASC staff. The training programme for ASC staff developed by SALAR’s experts comprises five modules. The support material for implementation of the training includes: a package of self-instructive power-point slides directed to trainers for group training and include instructions for trainers on how to conduct the training sessions, and a coherent Training Manual for the convenience of trainers that in addition to the actual thematic training materials describes the logic to the how the training material and how it should be used (target groups, maximum numbers of participants and so on). 5) Manual on awareness raising and citizen engagement at all stages of establishment and work of ASC. 6) Manual on sustainability and energy efficiency for the creation and maintaining an ASC. The manual and on-line calculator were presented at the forum “Energy modernisation of administrative buildings in Ukraine: practices and challenges” on the 7 November 2019, which gathered about 100 participants from Hromadas and other stakeholders including representatives of the Ukrainian Parliament. 7) Manual on anti-corruption and transparency 8) Manual on Inter-Municipal Cooperation (underway) SALAR are also responsible for policy analysis within the framework of U-LEAD. The work on this has progressed along efforts to establish relationships with the new government and responsible ministries. SALAR have intensified its work on communication and focused efforts on two different directions: Direction 1 is creation of content to ensure that all stakeholders as well as participants and potential participants of the Programme are aware and informed about the project’s activities and receive communication materials about its values (environmental sustainability, gender equality and transparency). This direction was facilitated by strengthening partnerships with different actors such as NGO’s, associations etc. to engage their channels in distribution of the information on the Programme and well-functioned ASCs among the expert community, hromadas residents, regional government and self-government stuff. This resulted in significant numbers of website statistics (18 000 unique site’s users) and Facebook content visibility (14 000 views of the most popular post for the reporting period). Direction 2 of SALAR’s efforts is the support and communication of the ASCs opening to ensure the visibility of Programme’s tangible results and presence of the Programme’s branding materials in the supported ASCs. During the reporting period 108 ASCs of Round 1 and 10 ASCs of Round 2 have been open. 35 openings have been highlighted/supported and attended by Communications Expert and Programme’s representative as a speaker at the ceremony.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
